resources.string:
Welcome to LowVisCam. LowViscam is a camera application specifically designed for low vision and blind users. LowViscam is designed to allow visually impaired persons the ability to frame their friends or themselves in pictures using face detection software. In order to utilize the full functionality of the face detection software, please use headphones while using this app. You will receive audio feedback depending on the position of the face in the camera frame. The farther left or right the face is in the frame, the more beeps you will hear. The farther up or down the face is in the frame, the higher or lower the pitch of those beeps will be. Beeps will also play in the left or right channels of the headphones depending on the left or right positioning of the face. For example, if a head is in the bottom left corner, you will hear 3 low pitch beeps in the left headphone. If a head is positioned in the center on top you will hear 1 high pitch beep in both headphones. A face in the perfect center will receive a separate ding noise. Multiple faces in frame are calculated by the middle point of all faces.
The image gallery is accessible by the image gallery button on the action bar. Each image in the image gallery has two actions. A long click will open the share options for the image. A single click will open that image in the image viewer. Left and right swipes in the image viewer will show your other images.
There are two themes available for LowVisCam, white background with black text, and black background with yellow text. If at any time you want to change the theme, select the \'Switch Contrast\' button in the action overflow button.
Simple enough right? You\'ll get used to it the more you use LowViscam. Have fun taking pictures!
